modules.description: Provides functions to retrieve and manipulate time values based on the Unix epoch, including conversion between time representations and timestamp extraction. Works with data types such as integers representing seconds and nanoseconds, and custom time structures for precision. Used to synchronize operations in networked or embedded systems requiring consistent time tracking across different platforms.

Provides functions to manage time values and time zone offsets, operating on tuples of (int * int64) and optional integers. Allows setting a base time, adjusting time zone offsets, and defining time periods for synchronization. Used to control time-based logic in networked applications with precise timing requirements.

Provides functions to retrieve the current POSIX time in various formats, including nanoseconds and picoseconds, and to obtain the clock's period and time zone offset. Operates with types such as `Ptime.t`, `Ptime.span`, and tuples of integers and 64-bit integers representing time intervals. Used to synchronize system time with high precision and determine time zone adjustments in network or embedded applications.
